data.title: Roy Campanella (1921-1993)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Roy Campanella born 1921 Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States died 1993 Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California, United States including ancestors + children + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Roy Campanella

Born 19 Nov 1921 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States

Ancestors

Son of John Campanella and Ida (Mercer) Campanella

Husband of Bernice Alvina (Ray) Campanella — married 3 Jan 1939 (to before 1944) in New Jersey, United States

Husband of Ruthe De Payton (Willis) Campanella — married about 30 Apr 1945 (to 25 Jan 1963) [location unknown]

Husband of Roxie Roseler (Joynes) Campanella — married 5 May 1964 in The Bronx, New York City, New York, United States

Father of Beverly Patricia (Campanella) Lofton

Died 26 Jun 1993 at age 71 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, Los Angeles, California, United States

Profile last modified 30 Dec 2023 | Created 25 Jun 2016

This page has been accessed 1,609 times.

Roy Campanella is a part of US Black history.

Join: US Black Heritage Project

Discuss: black_heritage

Biography

Roy Campanella is Notable.

Roy "Campy" Campanella was an American baseball player, primarily as a catcher. Widely considered to have been one of the greatest catchers in the history of the game, Campanella played for the Brooklyn Dodgers in the 1940s and 1950s.[1]

Roy Campanella was born in 1921 in Philadelphia. He was the son of Ida Mercer, who was African American, and John Campanella, the son of Italian immigrants.

He died in 1993.[2] Roy was in an obituary on 28 June 1993 in Asbury Park, New Jersey, United States. He died (age 71) in Woodland Hills, Calif.[3][4]
